text: Content of the ADR
translation: ADR的内容

text: The content of the ADR can have the following sections:
translation: ADR的内容可以包括以下部分：

texts: Title — Title of the decision record.
Decision — The decision that was made. For instance, use Elasticsearch for an enterprise-wide search API.
Status — Status can be proposed, accepted or superseded. If you make any decisions and you need to change them later, you can simply add a new record with the changed status.
Context — What is the context of this decision? It is important to capture the full context of the decision so that the reader knows the reasons behind it.
Consequences — In this section, you can add what would happen if this decision is made. It is important to list all consequences, both positive and negative.
translations: 决策-做出的决策。 例如，对企业范围内的搜索API使用Elasticsearch。
状态-可以提出，接受或取代状态。 如果您做出任何决定并且以后需要更改它们，则只需添加状态已更改的新记录。
上下文-此决定的上下文是什么？ 重要的是要抓住决策的全部内容，以使读者了解决策背后的原因。
后果-在本节中，您可以添加如果做出此决定将发生的情况。 重要的是列出所有正面和负面的后果。

text: The whole document needs to be one or two pages and not more than that. The idea here is to keep it light so people can read it.
translation: 整个文档需要一页或两页，并且不能超过两页。 这里的想法是保持轻便，以便人们可以阅读。

text: Developers need to see the ADRs all the time as they should be aware of the reasons why they are building something.
translation: 开发人员需要始终看到ADR，因为他们应该知道构建某些东西的原因。

text: History of LADR
translation: LADR的历史

text: While researching LADR, I came across a very interesting article written by Michael Nygard. The article talks about having a technique to embed architecture documentation as part of code itself.
translation: 在研究LADR时，我遇到了Michael Nygard撰写的非常有趣的文章。 本文讨论了一种将体系结构文档嵌入代码本身的技术。

text: Quoting from the article:
translation: 从文章引用：

text: Architecture for Agile projects has to be described and defined differently. Not all decisions will be made at once, nor will all of them be done when the project begins. — Michael Nygard
translation: 敏捷项目的架构必须以不同的方式描述和定义。 并非所有决定都会一次做出，也不会在项目开始时全部做出。 —迈克尔·尼加德（Michael Nygard）

text: This is true. Agile is widely used, and there needs to be a defined process to capture all architectural decisions. Often, we end up creating large amounts of documentation which nobody likes to read.
translation: 这是真的。 敏捷已被广泛使用，并且需要一个定义好的过程来捕获所有架构决策。 通常，我们最终会创建大量的文档，没人喜欢阅读。

text: As I read more, I found a better way to document your decisions.
translation: 当我阅读更多内容时，我发现了一种更好的方法来记录您的决定。

text: A Simple but Powerful Tool to Record Your Architectural Decisions
translation: 一个简单而强大的工具来记录您的架构决策

caption: Photo by Brooke Cagle on Unsplash

text: From the moment I took over the role of technology architect, I’ve been wondering why certain decisions were made instead of other options.
translation: 从我担任技术架构师的那一刻起，我一直想知道为什么要做出某些决定而不是其他选择。

text: Visio diagrams are great, but they’re nothing but pictures. They don’t tell you the story behind why certain arrows go a certain way and not the other way round.
translation: Visio图表很棒，但它们不过是图片而已。 他们没有告诉您为什么某些箭头以某种方式而不是相反地旋转的故事。
